text: This is a list of youngest Prime Ministers after getting elected. The youngest is William Pitt the Younger Rank Name Age at start Picture Country 17 Joe Clark 39 years 11 months 30 days 16 Sergey Stanishev 39 years, 3 months, 12 days 15 Jüri Ratas 38 years, 9 months, 21 days 14 Paetongtarn Shinawatra 37 years, 11 months, 27 days 13 Leo Varadkar 37 years, 11 months, 20 days 12 Simon Harris 37 years, 5 months, 22 days 11 Jacinda Ardern 37 years, 2 months, 23 days 10 Kristrún Frostadóttir 36 years, 7 months, 9 days 9 Philip Dimitrov 36 years, 7 months, 7 days 8 Zhan Videnov 35 years, 10 months, 3 days 7 Sergey Kiriyenko 35 years, 7 months, 25 days 6 Benazir Bhutto 35 years, 5 months, 11 days 5 Oleksiy Honcharuk 35 years, 1 month, 22 days 4 Sanna Marin 34 years, 0 months, 25 days 3 Waldemar Pawlak 32 years, 8 months, 0 days 2 Sebastian Kurz 31 years, 1 month, 19 days 1 William Pitt the Younger 24 years, 0 months, 205 days == Addendum and trivia == Waldemar Pawlak served as prime minister for 2 terms , in his last term, he was not so young but would still make it to the list, on top of Philip Dimitrov. === Other PMs === Name Country Age at start Mart Laar Estonia 32 Taavi Roivas Estonia 35 Pandeli Majko and Ilir Meta Albania 31 and 29 ==References== == Related pages == *Lists of state leaders by age youngest
title: List of youngest prime ministers
